name: 9H-Xanthen-9-ol
Reason: 9H-Xanthen-9-ol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The molecular structure of 9H-Xanthen-9-ol contains several functional groups and structural features that can impact its melting point: (1) The xanthene ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. (2) The methoxy group (O-CH3) adds approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. (3) The hydroxyl group (OH) can participate in hydrogen bonding, which might raise the melting point by approximately +10°C. (4) The carbonyl group (C=O) can contribute to the melting point due to dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10°C.
